value: Le Tambourin (The Tabor), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate from a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor environment, a figure of a monkey in gentleman's costume wearing feathered hat plays the tambor, an elongated snare drum. While drumming, he also plays a simple flute. Indications of a town in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
L'Organiste Ambulant (The Itinerant Organist), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate from a series of prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. At left, a figure of a monkey in gentleman's costume (wearing feathered hat) riding another monkey walking on all fours. The seated monkey plays music on an organ attached to the walking monkey, whose mouth is connected to a pipe attached to the organ. Another monkey uses a bellows to blow air into the monkey's rear end to create the music.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 2, Le Corps de Chasse (The Hunting Horn), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 2 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor setting, a monkey in a hunting costume kneels, blowing into a circular French horn. A hunting dog at right peers at him as he blows into the instrument.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 3, La Lanterne Magique (The Magic Lantern), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 3 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. On a small hill, a standing monkey wearing a waistcoat and pants with a music box strapped to his front and a magic lantern viewing machine strapped to his back; the figure approximates an operator of optical amusements. He cranks the handle on the music box and gapes with his mouth wide open, facing towards the right. A church and small town visible in background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, Le Zigzag (The Zigzag), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 4 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, two monkeys in human costume. At left, standing behind the figure at right, is a monkey wearing a feathered cap and tunic. He holds a long thin tube to his lips that he is using as a blow gun to shoot pellets at a bird in flight at upper right. To his right, a monkey on one knee holds a crisscrossing contraption to trap the bird in the air. He looks up at the bird with his mouth open and tongue hanging out. Indication of tree stump in background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Les fins Chasseurs (The Fine Hunters), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Part of a set of bound prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, two monkeys in human costume. At left, standing behind the figure at right, is a monkey wearing a feathered cap and tunic. He holds a long thin tube to his lips that he is using as a blow gun to shoot pellets at a bird in flight at upper right. To his right, a monkey on one knee holds a crisscrossing contraption to trap the bird in the air. He looks up at the bird with his mouth open and tongue hanging out. Indication of tree stump in background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 5, Le Faucon (The Falcon), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 5 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor setting, a figure of a male monkey dressed as a gentleman hunter, wearing a waistcoat with buttons, tunic, and pants. He holds a falcon wearing blinders (a hood concealing the bird's eyes) in his left hand and turns to face the left. In his right hand, he holds the leash of a hunting dog--the hound has its eyes near the ground at left.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 6, Le Repos de Chasse (The Rest from Hunting), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 6 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a seated monkey in gentleman hunter's costume (waistcoat, tunic, pants), rests against a rock. In his left hand, he holds a rifle (gun). In his right hand, he holds a dead goose by its leg.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 7, Le Lavement Donné (The Enema Given), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 7 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a group of three monkey figures dressed in human costume. The monkey at left reclines with its rear end exposed. He holds his hand at his head and has a shocked expression. The other two monkeys at right prepare to give him an enema. A kneeling monkey in the background holds the reclining monkey's tail and points. A seated monkey in the foreground holds a large syringe to the rear end of the reclining monkey.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Nouveau Livre de Singes (New Book of Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Bound volume of 12 prints featuring monkeys in human costume acting out various scenes.

label: Physical description
value: Bound volume of engravings on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 1, La Chasse au Lapins (Rabbit Hunt), Nouveau Livre de Singes (New Book of Monkeys)

label: Description
value: A crouching monkey wearing a long coat on the left holds a long gun and points it at two rabbits on the right. A dog is positioned next to him on his left. A tree appears in the middle of the composition.

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, Jardiniers Fleuristes (Horticulturists), Nouveau Livre de Singes (New Book of Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Two monkeys wearing long coats are shown carrying a small tree growing from a box. The monkey on the left is facing the viewer, while the monkey on the right is facing left.

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Designs for a Panel, Fire Screen, and Andirons, pl.3, XIe Cahier, Oeuvres de différents genres dessinée par J. B. Huet

label: Description
value: Painted panel with vase in candelabra decoration left; painted firescreen with winged putti standing between two vine scrolls,  two designs for andirons, right, reclining lion (above) and winged putti riding griffon (below).

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Title page cartouche in which is written: TROISIEME/LIVRE de CARTOUCHES/Inventez par J. de la Joüe Peintre/Ordinaire du Roy/DEDIE/à Monseigneur Loüis Anthoine/de Pardaillan de Gondrin Duc/d'Antin Pair de France, Chevalier des Ordres/du Roy, Lieuten.t Général de ses Armées et/de la haute et basse Alsace, Gouverneur et/Lieutenant General pour sa Majesté des/Villes et Duché d'Orleans et Païs Orle/anois, Directeur General des Batim ts/et Jardins Arts et Manufactures de/France./Par son tres huble et tres/Obeissa.t Serviteur/G. Huquier. The arms of the Duc d'Antin flanked by two Indian figures are displayed at the bottom of the cartouche. At right (middle background), the construction of a palace. At left, a wall with standing statue and steps.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 23 x 20 cm (9 1/16 x 7 7/8 in.) Sheet: 33.5 x 24.2 cm (13 3/16 x 9 1/2 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical cartouche decorated with branches, green leaves, and a spray of pink flowers, at right.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Liberal Arts

label: Description
value: Cartouche surmounted with head of Minerva and decorated with elements representing the liberal arts: a palette (painting); a horn, string instruments, sheets of music (music); a globe (geography); and an architect's implement (architecture).

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 22.2 x 19.1 cm (8 3/4 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33.5 cm (13 3/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing an Allegory of the Painter

label: Description
value: An artist wearing a hooded smock is seated in front of an oval canvas, a long brush in his left hand. A figure, at left, appears to be preparing paint over a coal oven. A bottle and other containers are below. A bust of an animal is at top right.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing Architecture

label: Description
value: Cartouche representing an allegory of architecture. A young man, upper right, holds a plumb line, which is suspended from and architectural form. A ruler, compass, and architectural elements are on the ground. A mask surmounts the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Evoking War

label: Description
value: At left of cartouche, a slave restrained by a ball and chain. A flag, spear, and shield are seen at left. Spears, torch, and canon are at right. A phoenix surmounts the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Garden

label: Description
value: Elongated asymmetrical cartouche decorated with tools of the garden: a rake, a hoe, a pitchfork, grapes, a shovel, gourds, sheaves of wheat, and leaves. A diabolical winged eagle surmounts the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche with Pastoral Motifs

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with a crook tied with a bow, a horn, a shepherd's hat, two lambs, a dog, and two baskets.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Evoking War

label: Description
value: Cartouche, elongated and asymmetrical, decorated with two fleurs-de-lis and the sun, a partially unfurled flag, a horse on its back, and fruits and leaves.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of Asia

label: Description
value: An asymmetrical cartouche with elements that refer to the continent of Asia: half-view of a camel (at right), a turban, and a steaming casserole pot. Around the river of the cartouche are clusters of leaves and fruits.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of Africa

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical cartouche with a giant lizard, a crocodile at top, the head of an elephant at right. Leaf and shell motifs decorate the border of the cartouche, a bow and arrow at bottom center.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche: Allegory of Fire

label: Description
value: Cartouche consisting of references to fire: a flaming torch (upper left), a flaming bottle (upper right), and a phoenix, a salamander and a mirror.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 22.3 x 19 cm (8 3/4 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33 x 23.5 cm (13 x 9 1/4 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of America

label: Description
value: A parrot is perched atop the asymmetrical cartouche, a bow, arrow, and horn at right, a monkey holding a long-handled fur-trimmed fan at bottom right, and a small animal at left. Leaves, flowers, and a gourd decorate the border of the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Country of China

label: Description
value: Cartouche composed of a shell in reverse. Perched atop the shell, a Chinese woman holding a paddle and a Chinese man framed by animal horns and holding a long-handled pipe. A bow and arrow at right. The arrangement humorously refers to a lumbering, slow-moving "dromedary," or the lack of progress of China in comparison to France.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Evoking the Season of Autumn and The Chase

label: Description
value: Clusters of grapes, leaves, and gourds surround a cartouche with pedestal elements on either side. A top the cartouche a dog grabs the leg of a boar that is spewing water. At bottom left are two dogs. At bottom center is a grotesque mask.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Surmounted by a Tiger

label: Description
value: A tiger holding a thyrsus atop a barrel that is probably pouring wine, his paw resting on the head of a putto. Clusters of grapes and leaves decorate the cartouche. Enormous fish are at bottom foreground.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A cartouche configured to serve as a console. It is embellished with heads of dogs, clusters of grapes, garlands, and fruit. A fountain is at right, bottles and a large melon below. At left, a stag, a hurdy-gurdy with its horn and flags blowing in the wind.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Forming a Bridge (Horizontal)

label: Description
value: A cartouche within a cartouche, forming a curved bridge on which a stag is pursued by two dogs. Below, a waterfall with a dog's head at center. At left, a bucket, fruit, leaves, a goose, and two heads of dogs. At right, a dog's head spouting water, to its right, a large leafy tree.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche with Crayfish (Horizontal)

label: Description
value: Cartouche with large crayfish dominating the central space. At top, elements of the chase: a hunting dog, a mandolin, a bow and arrow. At top center, a mask looking towards the sky. Clusters of grapes, leaves, and cascades of water at left and right of cartouche.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 24.3 x 21 cm (9 9/16 x 8 1/4 in.) Sheet: 32.7 x 24 cm (12 7/8 x 9 7/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Evoking the Chase

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with elements of the chase: a wounded stag, the head of a dog, a spear, and a dagger.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 24 x 18.5 cm (9 7/16 x 7 5/16 in.) Sheet: 33.5 x 24.2 cm (13 3/16 x 9 1/2 in.), print is tipped into sheet

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Evoking the Chase

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with elements of the chase: a hunting horn, two arrows (lower left), a bow, and a net.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Evoking the Sea

label: Description
value: Cartouche consisting of references to the sea: a trident (upper left), two horse heads, one with head raised, the other spewing water (lower right).

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 25.5 x 19 cm (10 1/16 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33.3 x 24.4 cm (13 1/8 x 9 5/8 in.), print is tipped into sheet

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche Decorated with Elements of Fire

label: Description
value: The center of the cartouche is defined by an iron door which is surrounded by elements of fire: salamanders spewing fire, serpents, torches, a pitchfork, and leaping flames.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 24.5 x 19 cm (9 5/8 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33.5 x 24.4 cm (13 3/16 x 9 5/8 in.), print is tipped into sheet

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with elements of death. At top, a skull wearing a papal cap. A fatal weapon extends from a cluster of leaves above the skull. Evoking a coffin and gravesite, torches, laurel leaves, a coat of arms, and implements of a grave digger (a pick and shovel) surround the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Evoking Aquatic Elements

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with aquatic elements: an oar, water reeds, and a trident at upper left; coral, shellfish, and shells at lower left.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Evoking the Continent of Asia

label: Description
value: Cartouche with symmetrical decoration: at top center, a crescent encircling two sprays of water; at left, a halberd (a 15th or 16th century weapon with an axe-like handle and steel blade); at right, a quiver. Entire composition framed with bouffant design, acanthus leaves and water.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Naufrage (Shipwreck), in Livre Nouveau de Douze Morceaux de Fantaisie (New Book of Twelve Works of Fantasy)

label: Description
value: Scene of a shipwreck surrounded by rocks and waves; below, sea creatures on shore. Above, cliff overhanging with waterfall, conch shells, plants, paddle, spear, and personification of wind.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
